<title level="1" right="Rules">[Hidden](/Rules.aspx?ID=2416)</title>

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 434 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
A creature that's [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=79) is only barely perceptible. You know what space it occupies, but little else. Perhaps the creature just moved behind [cover](/Rules.aspx?ID=2372) and successfully used the [Hide](/Actions.aspx?ID=2404) action. Your target might be behind a waterfall, where you can see some movement but can't determine an exact location. Maybe you've been [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=59) or the creature is [invisible](/Conditions.aspx?ID=83), but you used the [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=2301) basic action to determine its general location based on hearing alone. Regardless of the specifics, you're [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) to a hidden creature.

When targeting a hidden creature, before you roll to determine your effect, you must attempt a DC 11 flat check. If you fail, you don't affect the creature, though the actions you used are still expended—as well as any spell slots, costs, and other resources. You remain off-guard to the creature, whether you successfully target it or not.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
